document.heading: Prohibition of the Investment of Public Funds in Certain Companies Doing Business with the Government of Sudan Act of 2007

history.narrative: Law 17-106, the “Prohibition of the Investment of Public Funds in Certain Companies Doing Business with the Government of Sudan Act of 2007”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-134 which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 2, 2007, and November 6, 2007, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 29, 2007, it was assigned Act No. 17-225 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-106 became effective on February 2, 2008.
